I would recommend Abbot:

	http://abbot.sourceforge.net/

I would start out just trying the Costello tool (recorder/script
editor). It saves a recording of using your application as an
XML file and allows you to put appropriate assert's in the XML
script as well.

You can then play back the script using a specialised runner
(junit extension) and have the results compatible with the
normal junitreport format.

If you need to do advanced testing, you can then start writing
JUnit tests using the Abbot JUnit extension framework. There is
documentation and examples at the above URL.

Cheers,

Paul.
